title: IT and Data Communications Agreement - Israel Air at Ben Gurion Airport
summary: Agreement between Israel Air and AeroNet TLV Communications Ltd. for CUPPS/CUTE desks, connectivity, and support services at Ben Gurion Airport (TLV) from 01-Feb-2025 to 31-Dec-2025. Scope includes wired/wireless connectivity, VLANs, print and DCS/messaging support. Service levels include 99.90% uptime and strict response times. Security compliance aligns with ISO 27001 and includes annual pen tests. Pricing is per active desk/managed port with monthly fixed fees and Net 30 payment terms. Termination allowed with 60 days' notice for convenience or 15-day cure for repeated SLA breach. Governed by the State of Israel.
commercial_terms: Pricing: Monthly fixed fees per active desk/managed port. One-time setup fee for new gates. Payment terms: Net 30 days. No explicit rates or totals disclosed. Invoicing likely monthly per industry standard, not directly stated. No mentioned spend caps. SLA credits apply for service shortfalls (see SLAs).
slas: Monthly uptime SLA: 99.90% per site segment. For each 0.1% shortfall in monthly uptime, provider credits 5% of the monthly fee (capped at 30% per month). Performance: Latency ≤ 80 ms, jitter ≤ 20 ms, packet loss ≤ 0.2% (95th percentile). Incident response: P1 engage in 30 min and restore in 2 hrs; P2 engage 1 hr, restore 8 hrs. DR: RTO 30 min. Security breach P1: notify airline within 2 hrs.
edge_cases: REST API endpoint rate limit (300 requests/min); excess is queued. Type B fallback allowed during messaging outage at no extra fee. Custom Sunday change window (2:00-4:00) with 72-hour notice. Dedicated VLAN per airline. Quarterly DR failover testing. Secondary fiber path handled for disaster recovery.
risk_liability: Security: Data encryption in transit (TLS 1.2+) and at rest for logs; SOC with IDS/IPS and log retention. Critical vulnerabilities remediated within 7 days, high within 14 days. Annual 3rd-party penetration test. Data breach notification within 2 hours for P1 event. No explicit monetary limitation of liability or indemnity terms detailed.
termination_law: Termination by convenience with 60 days' notice. Termination for cause: 15-day cure following repeated SLA breach. Governing law: State of Israel. No specifics on survival clauses or detailed dispute resolution method.
operational_baselines: Service location: Ben Gurion Airport (TLV). Service delivery: 12 CUTE desks at T3 check-in, 6 at gates. Asset management by vendor. Bandwidth: 200 Mbps symmetrical, bursting to 350 Mbps. Change windows set Sundays 02:00-04:00 local with 72-hour advance notice. SOC monitoring, VLAN per airline, central queue management for printers. On-premises support for DCS and messaging services. Capacity and DR measures implemented (secondary fiber, quarterly tests).
